intro: Diplazium prionophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnate fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce numerous sporangia on the underside of the fronds. Diplazium prionophyllum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
